Floating Alerts (Message Toasts) [Bootstrap 4.2]

Guidelines

  • If an alert requires the user to take action, ensure the related action is clear and written in concise, readable language; avoid technical jargon and code.
  • Displayed alerts should be relevant to the user’s current task and provide only necessary information: overuse of notifications can cause the user to feel overwhelmed or annoyed, and often leads to notifications being ignored.
  • Notifications should be polite and dismissible by the user where appropriate.
  • When appropriate, use floating alerts that appear to ‘float’ above page content, and are automatically dismissed after a specified amount of time.
Alert Type Purpose
Success Use for Success messages that confirm that a task was successfully completed in the system.
Warning Use for Warning or Caution alerts, such as application outages or database issues. Warning alerts should be used to provide awareness, but not block the user from completing any task.
Critical Use for Critical alerts that are preventing the use from completing a task. If possible, provide information on how to resolve the error.
Informational Use sparingly for Informational alerts.

Documentation

Bootstrap Documentation

Note that floating alerts do not automatically manage screen position or layering. This means that it is possible to 'stack' floating alerts on each other inadvertently. Developers should ensure that an existing float alert is properly removed before adding another.

Modifiers

Class Description
.uxf-alert-description add class to a p element within div.alert to apply alert description styles

Javascript

Alerts use Bootstrap's alert plugin. Floating alerts use the following custom JavaScript included within UXFrame Plus.

Property Type Description
var = $UXF.FloatAlert(options) Method Initializes floating alert
.remove() Method Removes floating alert
text Option Floating alert message text
appendParent Option Parent location of alert when appended to page. Default value is 'document.body.' Value must be an ID.
timeout Option Length of timeout in milliseconds. Default value is 5000 and a negative value keeps floating alert on screen until it is removed
type Option Type of floating alert. Values include 'success', 'loading', 'warning', 'danger', or 'info'. Default value is success
screenPos Option Location of floating alert on screen in %. Default value is 65
dismissible Option Boolean value that determines whether a floating alert is dismissible or not. Default value is false

Convert from UXFrame v1 to v2

  1. Change all alerts from div .alert.{status} to div .alert.alert-{status}
  2. Change div.alert. caution to div.alert .alert-warning
  3. Change div.alert .error to div.alert .alert-danger
  4. Change ul to p
  5. Change dl to p. Use p.alert-description where dd was used.
  6. Add role="alert" to div.alert
